thread.title: 'I love this': Oak Hills High School hosts inclusive basketball camp for local districts
thread.title_full: 'I love this': Oak Hills High School hosts inclusive basketball camp for local districts

author: Chelsea Sick, WKRC
title: 'I love this': Oak Hills High School hosts inclusive basketball camp for local districts
text:
GREEN TOWNSHIP, Ohio (WKRC) - Oak Hills High School hosted a Special Olympics basketball camp, welcoming hundreds of local students of all abilities to participate in a day of dribbling, shooting and teamwork.
"We're playing basketball with our friends," said Aiden Vernatter.
"How does it make you feel," asked Local 12.
"Happy," he said.
Oak Hills Physical Education Teacher Jason Lewis invited students from Oak Hills, Southwest Local Schools, Princeton and Indiana Hill to join the camp.
"To watch our students and other students interact together and come together for a common goal is one of the most special things that we do here," said Lewis.
Oak Hills High School's girls and boys basketball players served as coaches for the camp.
"It makes me feel like I'm doing something better than myself, like making someone else's day better than mine," said Nate Riep, an Oak Hills senior basketball player.
Camp participant Ryan Link was thrilled with the experience.
"It's good, it's amazing, I love this," said Link.
The camp emphasized more than just basketball skills, but also life skills.
"My favorite thing is teaching them how to like share and be patient because everybody's like, oh, they want a shot, but everybody's learning they need to share and pass the ball to each other," said Rhianna Riep, a junior basketball player.
Those lessons are important no matter where life takes these students.
"I like to play basketball a lot. One day I'm going in a Warriors game," said Ryan.
Camp organizers hoped to expand the event each year. Those interested in participating in 2025 could contact Jason Lewis via email for more information at lewis_j2@ohlsd.org.
